skillTree.localised_description: Steeds have long, sinuous bodies that writhe ceaselessly as they dash towards the foe.
Straining steeds urge the chariot to full speed, where swirling shapes sear the air with unholy hues.
Exalted Chariots are a blur of chromatic scythes and slicing blades pulled by Slaanesh's steeds.
This one’s writhing form can slowly caress and tease, but also move like lightning when required, knocking a projectile from the air or batting it back at the foe.
This obsession with murder is just cheap, mindless bloodlust of the basest kind. To the servants of Slaanesh, there's so much more to life… and to death too, of course.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Khornate factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Khornate factions

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Perfect Prince can never have too many Devotees. It matters not one jot to Slaanesh whether they come to him willingly or are coerced into His worship.
The Prince of Pleasure whispers in the ears of all, pulling at the threads of their every deviant desire.
This one's deeds are legendary, inspiring mercenaries and heroes alike to join their cause.

effects.description: Unit capacity: +1 for Regiments of Renown
Unit capacity: +2 for Regiments of Renown
Unit capacity: +3 for Regiments of Renown

skillTree.localised_description: Sometimes the best offense is, in fact, simply the embodiment of offense; a champion who can scythe through weaklings like wheat and shatter even the strongest defense.
This one is no mere brute, but a warrior capable of leading or delaying blows to catch foes off guard, bypassing defenses and dodges alike.

Skill holds value, but strength seizes results. All the skill in the world, the prettiest lies and the hardest invective, serve only to obscure the truth of the world - that one must have the might to destroy , and the will to use it, to change anything.

The force of arrival is a profound weapon, one all too many warriors neglect. Not merely in presentation, though that is also important - but the bone-shattering force of the first onslaught, before the foe has your measure; before they know they should be running.

On the field of battle, few fights indeed boil down to something as nice and pretty as an honorable duel. Victory comes, not as the result of fair combat - but the ability to tear through battle lines, alone or with an army, until there are none left to oppose you.
Defense comes in many forms; blocking, parrying, avoiding, or simply ignoring an attack entirely all serve to avoid harm and demoralize a foe who cannot truly harm you.
Trickery and agility are useful enough, but little displays innate strength as well as being able to simply shrug off cannonballs and shrieking daemonflame alike.

The essence of victory in a duel is simple; do not be where your opponent's blade is. Easier said than done, for some. But this one knows the truth. They know how to move, or how to predict, though it is never quite clear to the foe what that truth may be.
The flesh is weak. It can bleed and burn. Iron, literal or metaphorical, is the truest defense. Whether through plate armor or potent wards, this warrior is no easy mark.
True invincibility may be a vanishing dream, but one can come close enough that the difference is academic at best on the battlefield.
A general's mind is as important a weapon as any blade, and must be honed just the same. To master the self is to master the world, using their army as an extension of themselves.
Too many warriors believe that movement is not a part of battle - but there is no battle without movement. Those that think statically are forever doomed to be run circles around by their foe.

Few can claim to truly be tireless, and those that are oft trade that boon for the will of a demanding god. But even the least man or grot can be trained to move beyond their limits, to keep going where their equals fade and fall.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -5% for units
	(Lord's army)

Vigour loss reduction: -10% for units
	(Lord's army)

Vigour loss reduction: -15% for units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who march beneath this general's banner take pride in their presence. They are more than an army - they are an ideal, and ideals never die.

There are those whose very presence awakens something new in the hearts of their followers; whether through fear, admiration, or devotion, a single thought crosses the minds of all those that behold them. 'I would die for them' 'I would kill for them.' It is difficult to tell which is the most terrifying.
Pure strength and arcane mastery are valid paths to victory, but cultivating the skill to step up when needed can break stalemates and lead to victory.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
This one excels in the heat of the moment, pitting the peak of their skill against their foe's and learning which is the greater.
Even an unstoppable force cannot break an immovable object. Learning to stem the tide, to stand against all comers and survive, can turn defeat into victory.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Lash of Slaanesh"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Lash of Slaanesh Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Lash of Slaanesh Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Acquiescence Upgraded"

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Pavane of Slaanesh"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pavane of Slaanesh Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Pavane of Slaanesh Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Hysterical Frenzy"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Hysterical Frenzy Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Hysterical Frenzy Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Slicing Shards"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Slicing Shards Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Slicing Shards Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Phantasmagoria Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: The Winds of Magic swirl around this wizard, an endless tempest of magical might ready to be shaped and unleashed on their foes.

Using too much magic for a spell or misusing the correct amount can have devastating consequences - fortunate that this wizard's incredible precision and discipline when casting allows them to wield the Winds more safely than most.
Weaving the remnants of one sell into the next spares the caster some effort in timing the winds around them, making successive casting less stressful.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -5% for all spells
Winds of Magic cost: -10% for all spells
Winds of Magic cost: -15% for all spells

skillTree.localised_description: Quantity has a quality all its own, and this sorcerer embodies the concept, hurling out spell after spell with seemingly reckless abandon contrasted against their trance-like state.
The world breaks and cowers before the mystical might this wizard brings to bear. All things are born of magic, and all are brought low by it.

effects.description: Passive ability: Heart of the Storm

skillTree.localised_description: Entrancing beauty, enthralling pleasure, exquisite pain. This perverse host will thrive upon the screams of anguish it inflicts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Aggressive deployment of experienced shock infantry can create gaps in the frontlines of opposing forces, openings to exploit with auxiliary forces or elite infantry.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for all infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +5% for all infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Vigour loss reduction: -30% for all infantry and monstrous infantry (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Combined-arms tactics fall apart if the line cannot hold. Thus, it is not that the line should hold - it must hold. There is no other option. Old hands and old warriors, united to protect that which lies behind them.

effects.description:
Melee defense: +2 for all infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: +20% for all infantry and monstrous infantry (Rank 4 and above)

Ward save: +10% for all infantry and monstrous infantry (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Squad- and regiment-size fire support takes many forms, but offers reasonable mobility and on-the-spot fire support for engaged allies, usually from medium range.

Missile damage: +5% for all missile infantry, monstrous infantry, and cavalry

Enable Ability: "Peerless Aim" for all missile infantry, monstrous infantry, and cavalry (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Heavy fire support can take many forms, but tend to bring firepower to bear that is difficult or impossible to match by smaller units. Whether through unmatched mobile fire support or raw potency of earth-rending barrages, it can demoralize and tear opposing forces apart.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +5% for all artillery, monstrous artillery, and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Reload speed: +5% for all artillery, monstrous artillery, and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for all artillery, monstrous artillery, and warmachines

Enable Ability: "Devastating Volleys" for all artillery, monstrous artillery, and warmachines (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Beasts of war, born of flesh and steel. Often imposing or outright terrifying, they shine as linebreakers and unignorable distractions, forcing the foe to dedicate significant resources to put them down rather than on more vulnerable auxiliaries.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +5% for all monsters
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +5% for all monsters
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for all monsters
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +10% for all monsters
	(Lord's army)

Splash attack power: +20% for all monsters (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +15% for all monsters
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +15% for all monsters
	(Lord's army)

Splash attack power: +20% for all monsters (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Attribute: Strider for all monsters (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Fast support units tend to lack the staying power of line forces, but offer unmatched mobility and potent shock potential to a balanced army. Preying on vulnerable support forces or engaged infantry, a thunderous charge or howling assault can shatter enemy forces in seconds.

Charge bonus: +5 for all cavalry, hounds and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Movement speed: +5% for all cavalry, hounds and warmachines

Mass +20% for all cavalry, hounds and warmachines (Rank 4 and above)

Ability: Old Hunters for all cavalry, hounds and warmachines (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Where battlefield conditions and the flow of battle permits, taking the opportunity to press forwards can push battle lines forwards.
Ride for ruin, and the world's ending.

stat_effects.description: x0.001 Dealt Collision Knocked Back Threshold
x0.001 Dealt Collision Knocked Down Threshold
x0.001 Dealt Collision Knocked Flying Threshold

skillTree.localised_description: Volley after volley will cut down foes, leaving nothing but a sea of corpses.

Pure power must be matched by disciplined determination - the ability to follow formation and not overextend in a wild frenzy of destruction. Pacing themselves allows a warrior to fight on, dealing accurate blows for longer.
Power is the only absolute. Let them cower behind their armor, their battle-hyms, their war-cries. They will break before our weapons will.
Even with all the cards seemingly against them, a sturdy defense led by the bravest or boldest can hold the line until conditions improve.

Advancing into hellfire amidst a storm of steel requires warriors built of sterner stuff. Learning how to approach volleys of gunfire or screaming warpflame, how to utilize armor or blades to deflect or dampen it. Surviving the training makes the battlefield itself seem trivial.

Even the greatest generals must sometimes concede the initiative to the foe -but to do so is not to concede the battle. If one can weather the storm, if they can survive the hardest strikes, the opportunity to strike back will always, always present itself.
Mobility is perhaps the greatest weapon a warrior can wield. Outmaneuvering the foe, pressing the advantage, can turn even a sure defeat into victory.
Wars are won, not merely by strength of arms, but by supply lines and grand strategy. Winning a single battle means nothing if that victory is not in pursuit of a greater purpose.
An army is only as fast as its slowest contingent. Understanding and applying this concept allows for unorthodox tactics and outmaneuvering the foe.

This general has a knack for attracting others to their cause and gauging exactly how far they can drive their forces, minimizing unnecessary losses and making it easier to replace fallen forces with willing warriors.
It is said that supplies win war rather than strategy. Perspective may temper one's opinion on that claim, but having resilient supply lines that can keep troops in good form does help.

Penetrating hostile territory where the land is as dangerous as its inhabitants can cause tremendous damage to an army and strain supply lines, unless properly reinforced and supported by effective scouting allowing for relatively safe passage.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Whether this general possesses true prescience or merely some facsimile of it is a subject of some debate, but the efficacy of their judgements is difficult to question. Few succeed at surprising them, and fewer still can do so on the field of battle.
Ths lord is not merely a general by necessity, or even choice; it is simply a natural evolution of what they are - of who they are.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +50
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: New recruits must be broken in order to be remade, undergoing harsh training now in order to become part of the elite.
Finding high quality recruits for any army can be difficult, but made much easier by a network of competent recruiters that can find more and more to join the cause.
Recruiting the finest forces to be found and training them harder than anyone else leads to unusually high quality additions to the army.

effects.description:
Unit recruit rank: +1
	(armies in local province)

Unit recruit rank: +2
	(armies in local province)

Unit recruit rank: +3
	(armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Training does not end when war begins; an army that is not marching or fighting is ripe for rigorous practice, and any flaws in their previous training can always be identified and corrected as possible.
Expertise in a particular territory leaves this general better prepared to govern than most, in whatever manner best sorts their kind.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: This lord's name is spread wherever they go, inspiring fear and adulation alike. Whether bolstered by overwhelming charisma, arcane might, or unfathomable cruelty, the populace is acutely aware of their presence - and their might.

Corruption not an evil to be warded away, but transcendance to be embraced. Perfection of form, perfection of art, perfection of senses; by embracing the Self, one can find joy in anything. No matter what is sacrificed. No matter what happens to the Other.
An empire cannot thrive without its people, and an army cannot march without warm bodies to fill it. How this lord encourage such proliferation is perhaps best left to the imagination.
Honeyed words may not be the fastest way to take over a country compared to strength of arms, but this one's silver tongue can accomplish seemingly anything.
A mind is a terrible thing to waste. This lord does not allow military responsibilities to quell their value in technological contributions.
Few excel at ravaging the lands of their foes as much as this one. Leaving a bloody trail in their wake, they turn the lands and peoples of their foes into fuel for their war.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%

skillTree.localised_description: Striking like the storm, this general has drilled their army to deploy far faster than most. Able to force the foe into disadvantageous fights before marshalling their own forces, this army is rarely engaged on even terms.

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: If they cannot control these realms, this lord will burn it down around them.
The only true form of control over a thing is the power to destroy it.

effects.description:
Income from all forms of post-battle loot: +10%
	(Lord's army)

Income from all forms of post-battle loot: +20%
	(Lord's army)

Income from all forms of post-battle loot: +30%
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Few have a talent for catching enemy armies off-guard like this one, always striking when the foe is marching or recuperating.
This one is wreathed in a sense of gravitas that draws the best and brightest to them like moths to the flame, eager to learn - or perhaps take it for themselves.

Leading entire armies of men, daemons, or monsters is not a task for the average warrior. Understanding the strategies needed to get the a concentration of force to the appropriate location, and the tactics needed to make use of it against another force, requires a mixture of practice and experience.
Heroes are future lords and legends - valiant fighters or potent sorcerers, each well worth the investment for the future.

Generals require excellent lieutenants to command their forces effectively - a concept this lord has taken to heart, taking great pain to cultivate the best and brightest amongst their entourages to ever greater heights.

No army can master every aspect of combat without compromising in some aspects. Making use of auxilaries from allied forces allows for a more versatile approach to combat, especially if the disparate units train together.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description: Greatly reduced chance of being detected while in ambush stance

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!
Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Well built, robust. Powerful.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +10% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
"I'm bored," said the perverse Lord of Excess. "What playthings can you offer me today?"
This one's eerily seductive beauty has proved to be most useful both in the bedroom and on the battlefield.
Flawlessness is not an unattainable goal for those who serve the Perfect Prince; for the chosen few, it can be a reality.
Even the purest, most virtuous soul can be distorted to vile perversion or inveterate depravity if the right sort of temptation is offered.
It is not enough to seek victory in battle. True victory comes in mastery of the self - in mastering the art of waging war, of fighting perfectly in every way.
Sickening beauty given flesh and sinew, the very incarnations of terror. Impurity will be removed from the world.
A Slaaneshi host on the warpath moves with unearthly grace, faster than sight and faster still than the bloody trails they leave.
A grand and intoxicating cruelty infects the host, seeking to perfect the first strike of each combat -as deadly, as exquisite, as slowly painful as possible.
The addling vapors of Slaanesh herself waft through the legion, imbuing each warrior with a sliver of the Dark Prince's own beguiling touch.
To accept exhaustion is to admit that there is a limit to the pursuit of pleasure, the journey seeking sensation.
The exquisite pain to be harvested from victims of a perfect charge is succulent beyond the wildest of dreams.
This host specializes in aggressive tactical deployment - manifesting or speeding as close to the foe as possible before the battle can even begin.
A legion born of nightmares, fear given flesh, with cruelty beyond compare. Little wonder that its foes greet its approach with the musk of fear.
The flawless skill of this host arouses strange emotions in the hearts of their foes. 'I could do that,' they think, forsaking formations and battle plans to do battle with a vile foe.
Inhuman physiology and centuries or millennia of honed skill allow this host to make fools of any foe's attempts to target them.

effects.description:
Melee attack: -5% for enemy units
	(local region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The very presence of this servant of the Dark Prince is enough to weave a sickly taint into the very land around them, driving men to madness and debauchery.

effects.description:
Leadership: -4 for enemy units
	(enemy armies in local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Nothing is enough. More feasting. More dancing. More fornication. More debauchery. More cruelty. More filthy lucre. He will have it all.
Dhar holds a certain appeal to those addicted to power, made all the worse by the Slaaneshi addiction to souls. Given the tools to sate their addiction, why would they hold back?

What began as a hobby - making a mockery of Dark Elven sorceresses - became genuine fascination with the endless torrent of phantasmal swords within the spell, striving to make each dance more beautifully than the last.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Bladewind Upgraded"

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Little soothes the soul - or lack thereof - so much as the moment of horrified surprise upon a foe's face when they gaze upward and see their doom approaching.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -4 for "Doombolt Upgraded"

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Speeding through incantations with flawess diction and superhuman speed, each spell can be cast and the next chained into without a moment's pause.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +3 per turn
	(own army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Fragments of ancient words - perhaps the tongue of the Old Ones, or Slaanesh's darkest secrets - writhe with unholy power, fueling the spells that steal them away.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -15% for all spells

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Dabbling in other magics have granted this sorcerer of Slaanesh a surprising breadth of magical discipline, fed to their army to spread glorious carnage.
A multidisciplinary approach to magic can grant delectable utility to wizards with centuries to spare, their studies and experiments uncovering secrets in how to most effectively cast magic.
Few, even among the legions of the Prine of Excess, can claim to hold such dedication to the perfection of martial mastery.
Deluding passivity rapidly gives way to unthinkable violence in the blink of an eye when the moment to strike arrives.
No servant of Khorne, this one, yet their joyous love of battle may seem eerily similar to an outside eye.
Even in combat, the hunger cannot be sated. They must feast; if not upon the delicacies of the world, then the flesh and essence of their foes.
Maintaining warding magic in the midst of melee combat takes remarkable strength of will and unbreakable discipline - two things this ancient adversary has in abundance.
Each movement perfectly calculated to avoid a blow, to unbalance a foe, to avoid harm. More importantly, a wondrous sight for all watching, beauty given form.
